Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan and New Zealand have faced off on 115 occasions in ODIs, with Pakistan winning 60 of those matches.
New Zealand have lost two consecutive matches, to India and Australia.
The Kiwis will still start the game as firm favourites, but recent form could make this a tighter contest than the World Cup table suggests.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan's next match at the 2023 World Cup will be against New Zealand in Bengaluru on 4 November, 2023.
The match will begin at 10:30am IST.

Here's when the match starts around the world and where to watch: India - 10:30pm (IST) Star Sports/Disney+ Hotstar; Australia - 4:00pm (AEST) Fox Cricket/9Now, Kayo Sports; UK - 6:00am (BST) Sky Sports/Sky Sports Go, Now TV; New Zealand - 6:00pm (NZDT) Sky Sport/Sky Sport Now; USA/Canada - 1:00am (ET) Willow TV/ESPN+
Others: Pakistan put up an excellent fight against South Africa, and put together a superb performance against Bangladesh to just about keep their top four hopes alive.
